basics.name: Zenan Li
basics.label: Shidler Undergraduate
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.B.A. in Accounting, Finance, and Management Information Systems in the Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawaii at MƒÅnoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

education.area: Accounting, Finance, & Management Information Systems (expected Spring, 2024)

work.summary: I assisted with teaching Chinese to children and teenagers in classroom setting, and I also provided technical support to teachers in different classrooms.
highlights: Successfully ensured the normal teaching of large classes on a daily basis
Successfully ensured that all students could understand the course content

volunteer.summary: Managing the financial aspects of the club
Created and coordinated community service events with different on-island organizations for club members to participate
highlights: Organized ten community service events with on-island organizations
Maintained communications, connections, and partnership with long-time partners of the accounting club
Donated over one hundred school supplies, toys, books, and art crafts to childrens and teenagers in need

volunteer.summary: Working closely with colleagues in the Club Senate to keep track of general members' payments of membership dues and participation in various events while identifying weaknesses and making solid improvements for the club
highlights: Efficiently recording and managing member participation for nearly 200 general members
Successfully hosting large events with colleagues in the Club Senate

awards.title: First Place Winner
awards.summary: I received the award for winning first place in the tenth grade division of the statewide Eddie Aikau Essay Contest.

awards.title: Provost Achievement Scholarship Recipient
awards.summary: A prestigious and competitive scholarship that selects 80 rising high school seniors each academic year and awards each of them $10,000 per academic year for up to four years to cover for tuition payments
